transcripts.text: Insider had an awesome report where one of their reporters went to a rural area of Eastern Virginia, an area that is quite conservative, went heavily for Trump in 2016.  And the reporter talked with some people who have long been Trump diehards, real loyalists.  And the reporter said that as he was going around talking to these people, he noticed that this was an area where from 2016 on, you could see Trump signs all over the place.  And they lasted year after year, but they've become more rare.  And that sort of tacks with what he got from some of these people he talked to, the big Trump supporters.  So I wanna go through a few of these.  Now understand it's anecdotal, but it is interesting what it might have been that finally got through to them.  So Cliff, a 25-year Chesapeake Bay waterman says, a few weeks ago, I could ignore the parts of his personality I didn't like.  That's over.  I don't believe anything he's saying now.  And indeed, the lies have, they've become pretty terrible.  And the consequences of the lies are far more obvious, Brett.

Sorry.  It's a shucking joke.  It's an oyster.
